title: Mashed Potato Casserole - Mont Pommes D'or | Jacques Pépin Cooking At Home | KQED
description:
Too many leftover mashed potatoes this holiday season? Jacques Pépin teaches us how to make Mont Pommes D'or or "Golden Mount of Potatoes". It's a mashed potato souffle that only requires a few simple ingredients and will liven up your leftovers with a delightful crispy top crunch.

What you'll need: 4 cups of mashed potatoes, three eggs, gruyere cheese, grated parmesan, pepper, oil

Jacques Pépin Cooking At Home 
Episode 122: Mashed potato casserole

About Jacques Pépin Cooking At Home: 

Jacques Pépin Cooking At Home features short recipe videos that transform readily-available ingredients into exciting new dishes, perfect for newly-anointed home cooks and seasoned chefs alike. Presented by the Jacques Pépin Foundation, an organization dedicated to enriching lives and strengthening communities through the power of culinary education. https://jp.foundation/
